laboratory_examinations.findings: Grayscale imaging shows a moderately distended gallbladder containing layering echogenic material consistent with sludge. No thickening of the gallbladder wall. No definite gallstones identified. Trace perihepatic fluid present. Mild intrahepatic ductal dilation; common duct measures 1.1 cm in diameter. No evidence of choledocholithiasis. Discrete hyperechoic shadowing foci within the fundus of the gallbladder may represent gallbladder polyps, measuring approximately 2 mm. No focal liver lesion seen. Right kidney shows no hydronephrosis. Pancreatic duct measures 3 mm in diameter.
Results indicate presence of PREVOTELLA SPECIES.
